headline: Why Vistra, AppLovin and Oracle Are Spiraling Today
summary: With the markets taking investors on a roller coaster ride of late, three technology stocks are on the downward slope today, including Vistra (NYSE: VST), AppLovin (Nasdaq: APP) and Oracle (NYSE: ORCL). The markets have been processing strong fundamental tailwinds against worrisome economic headwinds that throw the fate of short-term interest rates into the balance. ... headline: These Stocks Are Moving the Most Today: Nvidia, Oracle, Alphabet, Strategy, Intuit, Lilly, Gap, Elastic, Veeva, and More
summary: Stocks rallied Friday after the previous session’s selloff driven by concerns about bloated artificial-intelligence valuations.  Nvidia  rose 1.2%.  Nvidia’s report and better-than-expected guidance gave the market a solid read on artificial-intelligence demand but failed to reassure investors who have been fretting about where the money is coming from and whether it will be well spent.

headline: Oracle Stock Dives Below Key Level As AI Fears Fuel Sell-Off
summary: Oracle stock dived Friday, falling to its lowest point since June and below a key investor support level.  Oracle stock dropped more than 5% to 199.43 in afternoon trades on the stock market today.  The last time Oracle stock fell more than 20% in a single month was May 2002, according to IBD MarketSurge data.

headline: SoftBank reports: Debt issuance, OpenAI data center investment
summary: Yahoo Finance anchor Julie Hyman tracks Friday's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute. Oracle (ORCL) stock is under pressure, down 30% over the last two months. SoftBank (SFTBY) has reportedly issued another $292 million in bonds, according to Bloomberg. Additionally, the Information reported that SoftBank will invest up to $3 billion in a factory for OpenAI (OPAI.PVT) data centers. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Watch Oracle Stock for an End to the AI Slump
summary: Oracle  is a cloud-software company, now tied closely to the artificial intelligence investment trade, that may be doing the same thing.  Shares in  Oracle  have tumbled nearly 40% since early September, lopping nearly $360 billion from its market value, since the company unveiled a huge jump in projected revenue from its burgeoning AI business in early September.  Spending all that cash on AI infrastructure is, by itself, a key concern for investors worried about the financial arithmetic of the world’s hottest new technology.

headline: Bubble Trouble: AI rally shows cracks as investors question risks
summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -The biggest bout of volatility in U.S. stocks in months has revealed cracks in the artificial intelligence-related rally, raising questions about whether the market has been in the grips of a speculative bubble that may be popping.  Soaring valuations in AI stocks this year have stoked worries that Wall Street may be inflating ​another speculative bubble, with some of these fears coming to the fore after a stellar earnings report from AI bellwether Nvidia failed to rally the stock and broader market.  Several high-flying AI stocks have experienced sharp pullbacks, questions are mounting about when AI investments will translate into actual profits, and concerns are growing that enthusiasm may be outpacing the technology's near-‌term capabilities.

raw.headline: Bubble Trouble: AI rally shows cracks as investors question risks
raw.summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -The biggest bout of volatility in U.S. stocks in months has revealed cracks in the artificial intelligence-related rally, raising questions about whether the market has been in the grips of a speculative bubble that may be popping.  Soaring valuations in AI stocks this year have stoked worries that Wall Street may be inflating ​another speculative bubble, with some of these fears coming to the fore after a stellar earnings report from AI bellwether Nvidia failed to rally the stock and broader market.  Several high-flying AI stocks have experienced sharp pullbacks, questions are mounting about when AI investments will translate into actual profits, and concerns are growing that enthusiasm may be outpacing the technology's near-‌term capabilities.

headline: Netflix, Comcast and Paramount Make Bids for Warner Bros.
summary: The submissions meet a Nov. 20 deadline for a first round of bids set by the board of Warner Bros. Discovery, the parent of HBO, CNN and the Warner Bros. movie and TV studios.  Comcast and Netflix are most interested in the film and TV library, which includes everything fromto Bugs Bunny.

headline: Oracle Names Stephen Rusckowski to the Board of Directors
summary: Oracle Corporation (NYSE: ORCL) today announced that it unanimously elected Stephen Rusckowski to Oracle's Board of Directors and increased the size of the Board to 14. The election is effective as of November 18, 2025.
